channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Aukus: UK, US and Australia launch pact to counter China
item.description: Beijing says the deal, involving nuclear-powered submarines, undermines regional peace.

item.title: Most office workers will never return full-time, survey says
item.description: Most people do not believe workers will return to the office full-time, according to YouGov research.

item.title: Family wins court case over Staffordshire landfill site emissions
item.description: The family of a boy with breathing difficulties says a persistent smell is worsening his condition.

item.title: UK power prices soar after key cable hit by blaze
item.description: British wholesale electricity prices for the following day jumped by 19% to £475 per megawatt hour.

item.title: French storms: Nine drown in choppy Mediterranean sea
item.description: Those who drowned in the dangerous conditions were all in their 50s, 60s and 70s.

item.title: Marks & Spencer blames Brexit as it closes 11 French stores
item.description: Brexit has made it "near impossible" for it to supply fresh and chilled products to France, the retailer says.

item.title: Call for investigation of menstrual changes after Covid jabs
item.description: There is no evidence of any impact on fertility - but research will help to counter false claims.

item.title: England move up to third in men's world rankings
item.description: Gareth Southgate's men climb to third in the Fifa world rankings, equalling their highest ever position.

item.title: Co-op to start selling groceries on Amazon Prime
item.description: Shoppers will be able to order Co-op's full range of groceries via Amazon across the UK by Christmas.

item.title: Dad of girl murdered by Stephen Leonard says review rebuff 'unfair'
item.description: Jim Holt's daughter Lorraine was murdered in 1979 by a man who would try to kill again in 2018.

item.title: Mangrove forests: Photography winners show beauty of ecosystems
item.description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... why people are using a horse drug
item.description: Ivermectin is being used by some to treat Covid-19, despite the benefits being unproven.

item.title: The Papers: PM 'wields axe' as he 'lays ground for next election'
item.description: Thursday's front pages are dominated by Boris Johnson's major reshuffle of his cabinet.

item.title: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions
item.description: Amid a severe drought in the Prairies, some ranchers are trying to find ways to work with nature.

item.title: On the trail of fake medicine smugglers in Benin
item.description: Since the beginning of the pandemic, there’s been an increase in counterfeit drugs around the world.

item.title: Deathloop reviews: 'Ingenious' shooter is a contender for game of the year
item.description: The action thriller, which takes place in a time loop, delights critics as it debuts on Playstation 5.

item.title: Emma Raducanu 'hungry' to improve after US Open win - but not sure on Indian Wells
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu says she is "hungry" to improve after her US Open win but wants a few days' rest first.

item.title: The 22-year-old who took on a housing giant and won
item.description: As a new report claims dilapidated housing can kill, the BBC meets an unlikely champion for tenants.

item.title: Afghanistan: Life under Taliban rule one month on
item.description: Secunder Kermani looks at life in northern Afghanistan, four weeks after the militants seized power.

item.title: Five ways we think office work will change
item.description: How people think the coronavirus pandemic has affected the future of office work in five charts.

item.title: Covid: The lives upended by Australia's sealed border
item.description: Eighteen months after Australia shut its border, people reveal tales of separation and despair.

item.title: Alex Murdaugh: The hot shot US lawyer and the hit man
item.description: Months after his wife and son were found dead, police say a lawyer arranged a hit - on himself.

item.title: Foreign students struggling to pay for UK university
item.description: The pandemic has made studying in the UK more expensive for some international students

item.title: Help: Channel 4 drama examines 'undervalued' care workers during pandemic
item.description: A new Channel 4 film starring Jodie Comer and Stephen Graham is set in the early days of the pandemic.

item.title: Claims about Universal Credit fact-checked
item.description: The government and Labour traded claims about the decision to remove the £20 extra Universal Credit payment.

item.title: Champions League drama as Liverpool win, Man City hit six and Messi disappoints
item.description: After an opening night that failed to ignite, the Champions League signals its return with drama across Europe on Wednesday.

item.title: Nottingham Forest sack Hughton after dismal start
item.description: Nottingham Forest sack boss Chris Hughton after six defeats from seven Championship matches this season.

item.title: Aston Martin retain Vettel and Stroll for 2022
item.description: Sebastian Vettel will continue at Aston Martin for a second season in 2022 alongside Canadian Lance Stroll.

item.title: Koepka should withdraw from Ryder Cup if he does not love it - Azinger
item.description: Former US captain Paul Azinger responds to Brooks Koepka's comments about the Ryder Cup by suggesting he should pull out of the 2021 matches.

item.title: England to host invitational international women's tournament in 2022
item.description: England is set to host a new invitational international women's football tournament next year.

item.title: 'We've got to look after our players' - England set to rotate as ODI series starts
item.description: England will be without pace bowler Anya Shrubsole for the start of the ODI series with an ankle injury.

item.title: 'I didn't have jab and thought I was going to die' - the non-league boss struck down by Covid-19
item.description: After ending up in hospital with Covid-19 complications, joint Chester boss Anthony Johnson opens up on how "stupid" he was to delay getting vaccinated.

item.title: Liz Truss: Fast tracker who landed prime cabinet role
item.description: The life of the new foreign secretary, from left-wing parents to the top of the Conservative Party.

item.title: Cabinet reshuffle 2021: Who is in Boris Johnson's new cabinet?
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson reshuffles his cabinet for the first time since February 2020. Who's in it now?

item.title: Government reshuffle hires and fires
item.description: The prime minister has fired a string of cabinet ministers in a major cabinet reshuffle.

item.title: Nadine Dorries becomes new culture secretary
item.description: The MP for Mid Bedfordshire and former health minister replaces Oliver Dowden.

item.title: Is it safe to vaccinate our child? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about vaccinating 12-15 year-olds, the booster vaccine and other topics.

item.title: Covid: People are vaccinated - so why are there so many cases?
item.description: More than four out of five UK adults are now fully vaccinated, but daily case rates remain high.

item.title: Job vacancies: How do I find a new job and who is hiring?
item.description: There are record numbers of empty positions, figures show, so which sectors are looking to recruit?

item.title: Covid symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Hushpuppi - the Instagram influencer and international fraudster
item.description: How Nigerian Ramon Abbas went from a romance scammer to a so-called "Billionaire Gucci Master".

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: 'The near-death experience that made me a top musician'
item.description: When Tony Kofi had a near-fatal accident, he had a vision of himself playing a musical instrument. It would change his life forever.

item.title: Chaos and confusion: The frenzied final hours of the Afghan government
item.description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

item.title: 'I studied law in jail - now I want to change the system'
item.description: LaTonya Myers spent nine months in jail because she couldn’t afford bail - now she's helping others facing the same challenge.
